intro: Rubia pallida, commonly known as pale bugleweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Rubia pallida is often found in moist, woodland habitats and is characterized by its distinctive, creeping growth habit.
